conclusion: To determine the direction of the particle's motion from t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is v = 0 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity is v = -2 m/s.
The velocity is positive (above the t-axis) when the motion is in the defined positive direction.
The velocity is negative (below the t-axis) when the motion is in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.

premise: At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s, which is on the t-axis.
conclusion: This is a point of change in direction.

premise: From t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds, the velocity becomes negative.
conclusion: The motion is in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.

premise: The motion is in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.
conclusion: The motion direction of the particle from t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
